section.title: Backing up and Restoring Audit Logs
section.para: In order to enable backup of the audit log directory, follow these steps.

step.para: First, from the lifecycle manager node, run the following playbook:
This will create a job to back up the audit log directory on any node where that directory exists. In order to limit this to only specific nodes, use the --limit option of Ansible

section.para: In order to restore the logs, follow one of the following procedures:
To restore from the node that made the backup to the same node directly in the audit log directory (for example, the folder has been deleted):

step.para: Note the id corresponding to the job: "HLM Default: Audit log restore from ..."

section.para: To restore the backup in another directory, or from another host,

step.para: Choose from where you will restore (from Swift or from and SSH backup)
Swift: Create a restore config file (e.g. restore.ini) with the following content to restore from a swift backup (make sure to fill in <value> )
step.screen: [default] action = restore backup_name = freezer_audit_log_backup container = freezer_audit_backup log_file = /freezer-agent/freezer-agent.log restore_abs_path = <path to the directory where you want to restore> hostname = <hostname of the host you want to restore the backup from>

step.para: Or: Create a restore config file (e.g. restore.ini) with the following content to restore from an SSH backup (make sure to fill in <value>) SSH information is available in helion/my_cloud/config/freezer/ssh_credentials.yml
step.screen: [default] action = restore storage = ssh backup_name = freezer_audit_log_backup log_file = /freezer-agent/freezer-agent.log ssh_key = /etc/freezer/ssh_key restore_abs_path = <path to the directory where you want to restore> hostname = <hostname of the host you want to restore the backup from> ssh_host = <your ssh backup host> ssh_port = <your ssh backup port> ssh_username = <your ssh backup username> container = <your ssh backup basedir>/freezer_audit_backup
